CHARTERS OF THE sumus Passennus OF AYR 99

Andreas Hunter manu sua Frater Helicius Makeulloche manu sua lohannes Blair de Mydil Auchindrane Approbo et ratifioo hanc copiam asseverem in

omnibus et per omnia tenore eiusdem sub meis signo et subscriptione manualibus lohannes Blair manu propria etc.

Hec est vera copia una concordans oum principali ac originali carta copiata et collationato de verbo in verbum per me Stephanum Prcstoune notarium publicum tabellionemque burgi de Aire predicti pro tempore sub meis signo et subscriptione manualibus unacum signo et subscriptione manualibus dieti J ohannis Blayr notarii publici in maiorem signum rei veritatis eiusdem etc.

Ita est Srurmuus Psinemoun, Notarius.

Charter by Friar Andrew Leiche, prior of the place of the Friars Preachers of Ayr, and the convent thereos, with consent of frier John Grierson, professor of theology, provincial prior of the whole order of Friars Preachers within the kingdom of scotland, in favour of John Blair of Middle Auchindrane, and Helen Cathcart his wife, in conjunct see, and the heire-male gotten or to be gotten between them, whom falling, to one heir female, and these also falling, to the heire-male or to one female of the said J ohn, whatsoever, of all and whole atenement belonging to the said friars, in the principal street of the burgh of Ayr, on the east side of the said street, lying between the tenement of William Bannstyne on the north, and the common foregate of the convent end the passage leading from the said gato to the church and place of the friars on the south, and the ioresaid street on the west, and the cemetery of the hiare on the eset, containing of breadth in front 13} elis, and the breadth of the yard thereos 11 elis, ond the whole tenement and yard in length 43 elis ; to hold of the granters in feu-farm, fae, and heritage for ever, rendering the service of the burgh due and wont, and paying to the said prior and convent six merlis yearly3 with the condition that the said John and Helen should uphold the said tenement so ss to be stall times ina distruinable condition for the said six marks Dated at the said place, ad June 1557.
